data.title: Booking Agent
data.meta_description: One of the most iconic sex symbols of the 1970s, Britt Ekland is an internationally famous actress, singer, and author. She was cast as the lead Bond Girl in 1974’s The Man With The Golden Gun and has acted in a variety of film and theatre productions throughout her career.
data.text:
One of the most iconic sex symbols of the 1970s, Britt Ekland is an internationally famous actress, singer, and author. She was cast as the lead Bond Girl in 1974’s The Man With The Golden Gun and has acted in a variety of film and theatre productions throughout her career.

Ekland was born in Sweden and made her film debut in 1960. Soon recognized as one of the world’s most beautiful women, her first major supporting role came in the 1964 George Marshall Western Advance to the Rear. Ekland then received critical acclaim for her role as a burlesque dancer in The Night They Raided Minsky’s and went on to star in several horror films including Endless Night and The Wicker Man. She also made notable appearances in After the Fox, The Bobo, and Royal Flash.

In 1974, she starred as Mary Goodnight in the James Bond film The Man With The Golden Gun. More recently, Ekland has been a star in the theater, acting in several renditions of Cinderella. She has also appeared in reality television series including Svenska Hollywoodfruar, I’m A Celebrity…Get Me Out Of Here, and Let’s Dance 2018.

Ekland had highly publicized relationships with Peter Sellers, Rod Stewart, and Lou Adler, leading to her status as one of the most recognized names of the 1970s. She memorably featured in Stewart’s hit song “Tonight’s The Night (Gonna Be Alright)”. In 1980, she published her best-selling autobiography, True Britt. Britt Ekland is one of the most well-known talents of the 1970s and her legendary career shows no signs of stopping.
